prompt:
The company's name, Aeva, is a play on "Eve," the name of the robot in the Pixar movie "WALL-E."

The market for autonomous vehicles will grow to $42 billion by 2025, according to research by the Boston Consulting Group. But for that to happen, the vehicles will need new and more powerful sensors. Today's autonomous cars are ill prepared for high-speed driving, bad weather and other common situations.

The recent improvements in self-driving cars coincided with the improvements offered by new lidar sensors from a Silicon Valley company called Velodyne. These sensors gave cars a way of measuring distances to nearby vehicles, pedestrians and other objects. They also provided Google and other companies with a way of mapping urban roadways in three dimensions, so that cars will know exactly where they are at any given moment — something GPS cannot always provide.

But these lidar sensors have additional shortcomings. They can gather information only about objects that are relatively close to them, which limits how fast the cars can travel. Their measurements aren't always detailed enough to distinguish one object from another. And when multiple driverless cars are close together, their signals can become garbled.

Other devices can pick up some of slack. Cameras are a better way of identifying pedestrians and street signs, for example, and radar works over longer distances. That's why today's self-driving cars track their surroundings through so many different sensors. But despite this wide array of hardware — which can cost hundreds of thousands of dollars per vehicle — even the best autonomous vehicles still have trouble in so many situations that humans can navigate with ease.

Generate a summary:
response: <s>  Aeva, a startup company, has developed a new type of sensor that could improve the performance of self-driving cars. The market for autonomous vehicles is expected to grow significantly in the coming years, but current sensors used in these vehicles have limitations. The new sensor from Aeva uses light to measure distances and detect objects, providing more detailed information than existing lidar sensors. However, even with this new technology, self-driving cars still face challenges in identifying objects and navigating complex environments.</s>

prompt:
Smart electricity meters are to be introduced to every home and business in Ireland, after permission was given for the plan to proceed.

The Commission for Energy Regulation (CER) says the initial phase of the rollout will commence in 2019, with all 2.3 million customers receiving the meters by 2024.

The project will cost €1.2 billion, with electricity customers ultimately footing the bill over time.

According to the CER, electricity customers will pay around €5.50 extra on their bill annually over a 20 year period.

However, the regulator estimates that each premises will see savings of three to four times that from use of their smart meter.

Smart meters are next generation internet connected devices for recording and monitoring energy usage and will replace older mechanical meters.

They allow users to monitor their electricity usage closely and switch providers more easily.

They also enable those providers to offer more personalised tariffs, read meters remotely and predict demand for power more accurately.

The meters are also expected to help the environment by reducing the amount of energy used by people.

Other European countries including the UK, Sweden, Norway and Italy have already begun to roll out smart meters to users.

A pilot programme was run in Ireland in 2009 and 2010, during which time around 8,000 homes received network-connected smart meters.

The trial found that, on average, those using the meters saved 3% on their bills.

Now, following a long consultation process and a detailed cost benefit analysis that showed the investment represents value for money, permission has been given for the rollout to proceed.

This means the procurement process for the technology can begin.

Initially, around 250,000 premises will have the meters installed in 2019 and 2020, with 500,000 more receiving them in the four subsequent years.

People who request them, and homes and businesses that need to have older near end of life meters replaced, will be prioritised.

CER Commissioner Aoife MacEvilly described the meters as an upgrade to the next phase of technology, which, she said, will eliminate the need for physical meter reads and deliver better data results.

She said the third phase of the project, sometime around 2024, will see gas meters being upgraded.

Generate a summary:
response: <s>  The Commission for Energy Regulation has approved a plan to introduce smart electricity meters to every home and business in Ireland, at a cost of €1.2 billion. The rollout will commence in 2019 and be completed by 2024. Customers will pay an additional €5.50 annually over a 20 year period. The meters will allow users to monitor their electricity usage more closely, switch providers more easily, and save money on their bills.</s>

prompt:
News

Alibaba selling the fruit online in China through its produce platform

Chinese consumers can now purchase fresh Mexican avocados online thanks to a partnership between e-commerce giant Alibaba Group and ProMéxico, a federal agency that promotes international trade and investment.

The avocados became available last week through Alibaba's business-to-consumer fresh produce platform Tmall Fresh. To mark the occasion, ProMéxico invited Chinese opinion leaders and bloggers to its Shanghai office, where they got the opportunity to taste more than 100 dishes prepared with avocados, an event that was live-streamed online.

After the September 11 launch of the Alibaba-ProMéxico collaboration, Tmall ran a special avocado sale, selling 500,000 avocados, or 80 tonnes, in just two days.

The promotion also included a collaboration with Chunbo, an online retailer that specializes in organic and non-GMO food products. Fifty customers were invited to cook and then taste dishes prepared with avocados as the main ingredient.

Participants learned about choosing ripe fruit before preparing recipes that used avocados for appetizers, the main course and dessert.

Avocado consumption in China has been growing at an annual rate of more than 200%. ProMéxico explained that three-quarters of consumers are women, who prefer the Mexican fruit for its nutritional and skin-care properties.

The Chinese government has authorized the sale of Mexican, Chilean and Peruvian avocados, and the governments of Australia, New Zealand and South Africa are in the process of obtaining permits.

Despite the competition, Mexico remains the largest producer of avocados in the world. With 176,000 hectares dedicated to their cultivation and a yield that grew 4.4% a year between 2004 and 2014, national production is now more than 1.5 million tonnes.

The avocado sale on Tmall was a huge success, with 500,000 avocados sold in just two days. The promotion also involved a collaboration with Chunbo, an online retailer specializing in organic and non-GMO food products, where 50 customers learned how to cook with avocados and taste the dishes they prepared. According to ProMéxico, avocado consumption in China is growing at an annual rate of more than 200%, with three-quarters of consumers being women who value the fruit for its nutritional and skin-care properties. Despite the competition, Mexico remains the largest producer of avocados in the world, with a yield that grew 4.4% a year between 2004 and 2014, resulting in a national production of more than 1.5 million tonnes.</s>

prompt:
Endeavor Robotics secured a contract with the U.S government for 75 of its FirstLook robots, its third major contract with the government in six weeks.

"FirstLook is the most preferred lightweight reconnaissance robot in its class because of how easily and quickly it can be deployed while withstanding the abuse of ground operations," president Tom Frost said in a press release. "It gives me great pride to know that we are doing our part each and every day to reduce human exposure to potentially lethal situations."

The five-pound robot, which moves on treads, serves the military, law enforcement and energy industries and performs reconnaissance missions, clears buildings and detects IEDs using day/night cameras and two-way audio. Operators control the robot with a remote, and the machine can be thrown or dropped from 15 feet onto concrete without being damaged.

In August, the company received a $15 million order from the government for upgrades and accessories to support robotic systems already in use. Earlier in the month, the government purchased 32 small unmanned ground vehicles with the Endeavor Robotics uPoint Multi-Robot Control System, which decreases on-robot training time using technology and tablet-based user-interfaces.

"We are proud to respond to the needs of our customers," CEO Sean Bielat said in a statement. "We are a highly responsive, customer-focused, agile company that stands positioned to rapidly provide upgrades, accessories, and new platforms whenever called upon by our customers. We remain ready 24/7 to meet the needs of our valued customers, helping them place distance between themselves and the incredible hazards that they bravely face each day."

Generate a summary:
response: <s>  Endeavor Robotics has recently secured a contract with the U.S government for 75 of its FirstLook robots, its third major contract with the government in six weeks. The five-pound robot is used for reconnaissance missions, clearing buildings and detecting IEDs and can be thrown or dropped from 15 feet onto concrete without being damaged. The company has also received two other government contracts this month, totaling $15 million, for upgrades and accessories to support existing robotic systems. CEO Sean Bielat stated that the company is highly responsive to customer needs and is ready to provide assistance 24/7.</s>

prompt:
President Trump's threats and actions to undermine Obamacare come at a cost: In a report released Thursday, the Congressional Budget Office projects that premiums for benchmark silver plans will increase by an average of 15 percent next year.

The nonpartisan budget referee expects premiums for those plans to rise by 5 percent a year until 2027. But the projected jump for next year is much steeper, the CBO says, "largely because of short-term market uncertainty—in particular, insurers' uncertainty about whether federal funding for certain subsidies that are currently available will continue to be provided— and an increase in the percentage of the population living in areas with only one insurer in the marketplace."

The Trump administration has not yet said whether it will continue to pay roughly $7 billion a year for so-called cost-sharing reductions — subsidies that help reduce deductibles and co-pays for low-income enrollees. In the meantime, it has slashed spending on advertising and outreach, and shortened the enrollment period to six weeks from about three months. This week, the Department of Health and Human Services told groups that assist with Obamacare enrollments that their budgets will be cut, in some cases by more than 90 percent. (For more on the effects of these cuts, check out this piece at Vox by Lori Lodes, the former director of the office of communications at the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.)

As a result of those cuts to programs driving signups and of the higher premiums it expects, CBO also projects future enrollment through Obamacare exchanges to be lower than it had previously forecast. A March 2016 CBO report projected that about 18 million Americans would be covered through the Obamacare marketplaces by 2018. The new report projects that enrollment will climb from 10 million this year to 11 million next year and then stabilize at around 12 million from 2019 through 2027.

CBO last month said that if President Trump followed through on his threat to cut federal cost-sharing subsidies, silver plan premiums would rise by an average of 20 percent next year and, as a result, the federal deficit would climb by $194 billion through 2026 as the cost of government tax credits increased along with the rising premiums.

Insurers have until September 27 to decide whether and how they will participate in Obamacare markets.

Generate a summary:
response: <s>  President Trump's actions to undermine Obamacare are expected to lead to higher premiums for benchmark silver plans, according to a report by the Congressional Budget Office. The nonpartisan budget referee projects that premiums for those plans will increase by an average of 15 percent next year, largely due to short-term market uncertainty and an increase in the percentage of the population living in areas with only one insurer in the marketplace. The report also projects that future enrollment through Obamacare exchanges will be lower than previously forecast, climbing from 10 million this year to 11 million next year and then stabilizing at around 12 million from 2019 through 2027. CBO last month said that if President Trump followed through on his threat to cut federal cost-sharing subsidies, silver plan premiums would rise by an average of 20 percent next year, leading to a higher federal deficit through 2026 as the cost of government tax credits increased along with the rising premiums. Insurers have until September 27 to decide whether and how they will participate in Obamacare markets.</s>

prompt:
In 1986, Geoffrey Hinton co-authored a paper that, three decades later, is central to the explosion of artificial intelligence. But Hinton says his breakthrough method should be dispensed with, and a new path to AI found.

Speaking with Axios on the sidelines of an AI conference in Toronto on Wednesday, Hinton, a professor emeritus at the University of Toronto and a Google researcher, said he is now "deeply suspicious" of back-propagation, the workhorse method that underlies most of the advances we are seeing in the AI field today, including the capacity to sort through photos and talk to Siri. "My view is throw it all away and start again," he said.

The bottom line: Other scientists at the conference said back-propagation still has a core role in AI's future. But Hinton said that, to push materially ahead, entirely new methods will probably have to be invented. "Max Planck said, 'Science progresses one funeral at a time.' The future depends on some graduate student who is deeply suspicious of everything I have said."

How it works: In back propagation, labels or "weights" are used to represent a photo or voice within a brain-like neural layer. The weights are then adjusted and readjusted, layer by layer, until the network can perform an intelligent function with the fewest possible errors.

But Hinton suggested that, to get to where neural networks are able to become intelligent on their own, what is known as "unsupervised learning," "I suspect that means getting rid of back-propagation."

"I don't think it's how the brain works," he said. "We clearly don't need all the labeled data."

Generate a summary:
response: <s>  Geoffrey Hinton, the co-author of a paper that sparked the AI explosion, now says that the workhorse method behind it, back-propagation, should be discarded. He believes that entirely new methods will need to be invented to push AI forward materially. However, other scientists at the conference argued that back-propagation still has a core role to play in AI's future.</s>

prompt:
Older adults are admitted to hospice for short duration despite experiencing symptoms months prior to the end of life, according to a Yale-led study. The finding highlights the need for earlier hospice admission or other strategies to address increasing symptoms and disability at the end of life, the researchers said.

The study was published on September 12 in the Journal of the American Geriatrics Society.

The researchers examined information from a study of 562 people, aged 70 and older, who were not disabled when the study began but died over the following 16 years. Of these individuals, 244 (43.4 percent) were admitted to hospice during the last year of life. They were slightly older and more likely to have cognitive impairments (problems thinking and making decisions) than older adults who weren't admitted to hospice.

The researchers found that cancer and advanced dementia were the conditions that most often resulted in hospice admission. Older adults who were frail were least likely to be admitted to hospice. The most common condition leading to death was frailty, followed by organ failure, advanced dementia, and cancer.

The study also found that the duration of hospice care was less than 13 days for half of the study participants. This short duration suggests that healthcare providers might need to consider discussing referrals to hospice sooner with people who are approaching the end of their lives. Alternatively, providers may need to develop and test other ways to reduce the high burden of distressing symptoms and disability at the end of life, said the researchers.

"Failing or delaying to refer older persons to hospice at the end of life can place a high burden on caregivers and result in patient suffering," said Dr. Thomas Gill, the Humana Foundation Professor of Medicine and the study's first author.

Referral to hospice at the end of life should be based on an older adult's burden of pain and other distressing symptoms, suggest the researchers. Those symptoms include fatigue, nausea, depression, anxiety, difficulty sleeping, and difficulty with memory, among others.

Study authors are Dr. Ling Han, Linda Leo-Summers, Dr. Evelyne A. Gahbauer, and Heather G. Allore.

The work for this report was funded by grants from the National Institute on Aging. The study was conducted at the Yale Claude D. Pepper Older Americans Independence Center.

Generate a summary:
response: <s>  Older adults are admitted to hospice for short duration despite experiencing symptoms months prior to the end of life, according to a Yale-led study. The researchers found that cancer and advanced dementia were the conditions that most often resulted in hospice admission. The most common condition leading to death was frailty, followed by organ failure, advanced dementia, and cancer. The study also found that the duration of hospice care was less than 13 days for half of the study participants. This short duration suggests that healthcare providers might need to consider discussing referrals to hospice sooner with people who are approaching the end of their lives.</s>

prompt:
How to choose a Pos system for your business?

Whether you are starting a new business or expanding an existing one, choosing the right POS system can make all the difference. In the past, your POS system was a cash register and a credit card machine. Now, however, POS systems contain much more than basic transaction functionality.

Determine Your Needs

Honestly, assess the size of your business and how large you plan to grow it over the next few years. If you own a small restaurant and never plan to open a second location, then you don't need multi-location support and you also likely do not need an inventory system that can handle 500,000 unique identifiers. If you are running a small restaurant, chances are, you would be just fine with a POS system that provides basic inventory functionality, timesheet integration, and a table map in addition to basic transaction functionality.

The reverse is also true; if you own a local chain of restaurants, then you will need multi-location support if you want to be able to manage all of your locations together, rather than running all of the sites separately.

What Are The Main Differences Between Small and Large Business POS Systems?

First, price is going to be a factor to consider. A POS system designed for a medium or large business is going to demand a premium that is often more than a small business owner can afford or is willing to pay. For larger companies, this cost is worth the extra functionality that these systems offer.

POS systems designed for small businesses are often robust enough to manage your daily needs, but they are also simple enough that you will not have to dedicate several hours a week to just maintaining your POS system. When you start getting into POS systems for medium and large scale businesses, the initial setup, as well as maintenance, complexity grows immensely. The main sectors for POS systems are Retail and Restaurant business.

Generate a summary:
response: <s>  When choosing a POS system for your business, it's essential to assess your needs and the size of your business. Determine whether you require multi-location support or inventory management with a vast number of SKUs. Consider the price of the system and the complexity of its setup and maintenance. Additionally, determine if you require specific features such as timesheet integration or a table map. Ultimately, choose a system that meets your business's unique needs and grows with your business.</s>

prompt:
Dive Brief:

A report from Noodle Markets shows school district spending on adaptive learning technology has tripled to $41 million since 2013, with 9% of those funds spent on teacher professional development, according to EdTech: Focus on K-12.

Adaptive learning tech uses algorithms and data to present students with content matched to their current progress, with the idea being that it simplifies personalized and self-paced learning for teachers.

Some schools have developed simplified workarounds to more specific adaptive tech, using Google Forms and Google Sheets to deliver content to students based on how they respond to questions, and success with adaptive tools has also required some schools and districts to strengthen and expand their infrastructure.

Dive Insight:

The last several years have seen a push to provide students with educational experiences personalized to fit their needs and current progress. And while doing so has long proven effective in some private school models, like the Montessori system, it's been much harder to scale to the often-larger class sizes found in many public schools.

That's where adaptive learning tech has stepped in, serving as a means of gathering data on students' progress and presenting them with harder content when they're ready to progress or reviewing content at their current level if they're not at that point yet. Used in combination with a flipped learning model, for example — where the student engages with pedagogical content that would traditionally be delivered in class and engages in discussion or completes assignments or projects during class time — it has the potential to deliver on that promise.

Notably, however, this can require some additional time commitment on the part of educators, as the model can require additional preparation and deeper assignments on top of the extra one-on-one time with students. As a result, administrators will want to keep in mind the potential for teacher burnout and how to address it when considering such a model.

Generate a summary:
response: <s>  Adaptive learning technology has seen an increase in spending in recent years, with school districts spending $41 million on it since 2013. While this technology uses algorithms and data to present students with content matched to their current progress, it also requires teacher professional development, and some schools have developed simpler workarounds using Google Forms and Sheets. Success with adaptive tools has also required strengthening infrastructure. While this model has potential to deliver personalized learning, it can also require additional teacher preparation and one-on-one time with students, which can lead to burnout.</s>

The conference highlighted the importance of the fee schedule in setting payment rates, making real-time payments to providers, and calculating shared savings, even as APMs become more prevalent. Overall, the conference provided a comprehensive overview of the challenges and opportunities in reforming the PFS and transitioning to new payment models.</s>

prompt:
Reports

For years Fintech has been the hottest topic of discussion in financial services, with incumbents, regulators, and consumers all asking the same question: "Will small technology-enabled 'fintech' start-ups redefine the way that banks and insurers operate, and upend the competitive landscape of the industry?"

Building on the findings of the 2015 World Economic Forum report "The Future of Financial Services," this document considers the evolution and impact of fintech firms on financial services to date and presents a series of contrasting outlooks for the future of the industry.

Our findings suggest that fintechs have materially changed the basis of competition in financial services, but have not yet materially changed the competitive landscape. They play a critical role in defining the pace and direction of innovation across the sector but have struggled to overcome the scale advantages of large financial institutions.

Other key findings of the report include:

• Platforms Rising: Platforms that offer the ability to engage with different financial institutions from a single channel will become the dominant model for the delivery of financial services.

• Financial Regionalization: Differing regulatory priorities, technological capabilities, and customer needs are challenging the narrative of increasing financial globalization and making way for regional models of financial services suited to local conditions.

• Systemically Important Techs: Efforts by incumbent financial institutions to emulate the core capabilities of large technology firms will lead to an increasing reliance on those same large technology firms.

This report represents the culmination of three years of research into the transformation of financial services prepared by the World Economic Forum in collaboration with Deloitte.

Generate a summary:
response: <s>  The World Economic Forum and Deloitte collaborated on a report that examines the impact of fintech firms on financial services to date and presents varying outlooks for the future of the industry. The report finds that fintechs have changed the basis of competition in financial services but have not yet altered the competitive landscape. Platforms that allow users to engage with multiple financial institutions from a single channel are expected to become the dominant model for delivering financial services. Differing regulatory priorities and customer needs are leading to regional financial models tailored to local conditions. Efforts by incumbent financial institutions to emulate large technology firms may lead to increased reliance on those same firms.</s>

The regulators said in a statement:

"With the offerings that we have reviewed to date, we have in many instances found that the coins/tokens in question constitute securities for the purposes of securities laws, including because they are investment contracts."

Ire of the fintech community

It has prompted some of Canada's leading fintech executive to criticize and seek clarity from the Canadian Securities Administrators.

"There still is a lot of gray area in terms of the guidance on when a cryptocurrency or token would be a security," said Daniel Fuke, a partner in the securities and M&A group at Fasken Martineau.

"It would be nice if we could know from CSA what they were thinking in terms of some of the sub-considerations of the securities law test."

Pressure from the South

In essence, ICOs would be controlled by these securities laws unless a valid exemption could apply.

Generate a summary:
response: <s>  The Canadian Securities Administrators (CSA) have stated that many initial coin offerings (ICOs) are similar to the sale of securities and should therefore be subject to the same rules that govern securities. This has caused some concern within the fintech community, with calls for greater clarity and guidance on when a cryptocurrency or token would be considered a security. The US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has already made a similar ruling, stating that ICOs must obey federal laws unless a valid exemption can be applied.</s>

Now that Republicans have failed to pass multiple versions of health care bills to repeal and replace Obamacare, or just repeal it, there's only one GOP health care bill left floating around: one offered by Sens. Bill Cassidy (R-LA) and Lindsey Graham (R-SC) and cosponsored by Sen. Dean Heller (R-NV).

In broad strokes, the plan would reduce spending over time by converting Medicaid payments to the states into block grants while gradually reducing federal support. It would also give states more leeway to place limits on health care coverage.

But an analysis by the liberal-leaning Center on Budget and Policy Priorities published on Thursday finds that the plan would have effects similar to other Republican plans scored by the Congressional Budget Office: "It would cause many millions of people to lose coverage, radically restructure and deeply cut Medicaid, increase out-of-pocket costs for individual market consumers, and weaken or eliminate protections for people with pre-existing conditions."

According to CBPP, the reductions would hit a handful states especially hard: California, Connecticut, Delaware, Florida, Massachusetts, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, and Virginia, plus the District of Columbia. These states embraced expanded Medicaid under the Affordable Care Act, and a result account for a large share of spending under the expansion. The Cassidy-Graham bill takes aim at that spending and essentially redirects the money toward non-expansion states, even as it reduces payments overall. Funding for Medicaid expansion would end entirely after 2026.

This redistributive effort appears to be central to the political strategy behind the bill. Former Sen. Rick Santorum recently told Breitbart that he has "no question that we can get very broad support among the Republican base and frankly this will get support from a Democrat or two. The reason is because of the way that Obamacare is structured, it benefits a handful of states."

Taking from New York and giving to Alabama may indeed be a winning strategy. That may be why former Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services administrator Andy Slavitt recently tweeted that "The most viable effort 2 repeal the ACA is Graham Cassidy Heller."

You can review the CBPP analysis in full here.

Generate a summary:
response: <s>  With the failure of previous Republican health care bills, the Cassidy-Graham bill remains the only GOP proposal still in play. The bill would convert Medicaid payments to states into block grants and reduce federal support over time, while also giving states more leeway to limit health care coverage. According to a liberal-leaning analysis, this would result in millions losing coverage, deep cuts to Medicaid, higher out-of-pocket costs, and weaker protections for those with pre-existing conditions. The plan would particularly hurt states that expanded Medicaid under the Affordable Care Act, such as California, Connecticut, Delaware, Florida, Massachusetts, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Virginia, and the District of Columbia. The bill's redistributive effort appears to be a political strategy to gain broad Republican support, as it takes from expansion states and gives to non-expansion states. A former CMS administrator has called this the most viable effort to repeal the ACA.</s>

Although some fine-tuning was still necessary after the AI delivered its part, she arranged what was offered into verses and a chorus.

"In the past, I'd get into traps of writing songs in a given style or chords I know I like," Southern said. "When working with AI music, everything it spits at me is a surprise."

response: <s>  Taryn Southern, a popular YouTube artist, has teamed up with artificial intelligence to create her latest album. The album's first song, "Break Free," was developed with the help of Amper Music, a startup that provides AI music services. Southern gave the program some guidelines, and it produced a track for her to consider. She then arranged what was offered into verses and a chorus. Southern said writing the structure of the song is now faster than when relied on human musicians. The album will debut later this year.</s>

Research into the capabilities of WannaCry internationally cast further doubt on the ability of certain countries, India among them, to resist infection.

Rajarajan said that security of IoT devices used in health networks and elsewhere would also form an area of investigation.

The NHS also faced calls to meet attackers with Blockchain tools immediately following the hack.

Dentsu said the decline was "impacted by strong performance" against previous year-on-year periods, as well as "challenging market conditions" and new business wins that will not be realised until the third quarter.

In EMEA, organic gross profit declined by 0.3% for the quarter, with Russia, Poland and the Nordics singled out as strong growth markets. The region hit double-digit growth for five quarters in a row between Q1 2015 and Q1 2016, and posted organic growth higher than 5% for the following four quarters after that until today's report.

However, EMEA remains DAN's best-performing region in terms of organic gross profit growth, as Q2 declines were worse in Asia-Pacific (down 3.8%) and the Americas (down 4.1%).

Analysts at Liberum reported that Dentsu has lowered its projection of full-year net sales by 1.5% on the back of weaker spending commitments by FMCG companies at the start of the year.

"We believe that the weakness in the consumer packaged good companies' spend is cyclical and point to comments from the big FMCG companies that suggest a rise in marketing spend in H2," Liberum told investors.

In June, DAN's global chief executive Jerry Buhlmann told Campaign "the direction of travel is down" as the network downgraded its growth forecast for the global ad market to 3.8% this year compared to 4.8% in 2016.

Buhlmann also warned about a "slowdown" in digital advertising in the wake of the brand safety row earlier this year involving YouTube and other online platforms.

Dentsu Aegis Network's clients include Adidas, Burberry, Diageo and General Motors.

Toshihiro Yamamoto, president and chief executive of Dentsu, said of today's disclosure: "Going into the second half of the year, despite uncertain market conditions, the group is well placed to realise the positive impact of strong new business wins in the first half of 2017."

response: <s>  Dentsu Aegis Network reported a decline in organic gross profit growth for its second quarter of 2017, with the EMEA region performing best but still experiencing a slight decrease. The decline was attributed to strong performance against previous year-on-year periods and challenging market conditions. In terms of regions, Asia-Pacific and the Americas saw worse declines than EMEA. Despite this, Dentsu remains optimistic about the second half of the year due to positive impact from strong new business wins in the first half.</s>

ThirdEye Debuts 3-Screen AR System for Education

Education will shortly have a new option in the augmented reality (AR) segment. A company that has built its reputation in the defense industry is releasing a bundle that includes AR smartglasses and an app that allows for remote instruction. ThirdEye's X1 "smartglass" is a headset that allows the wearer to experience a 1,280 x 720 pixel binocular display that is equivalent to viewing a 90-inch screen at 10 feet.

Coupled with the company's enterprise application, users can receive instruction through a three-screen view. When wearers look straight ahead, the view is clear; they see what's in front of them. With a turn to the left, wearers view a video screen allowing them to communicate with and view a remote person. With a turn to the right, users see "data" screens, displaying instruction. For example, if somebody is repairing a piece of equipment, he or she can share the view with a remote person, communicate with that individual and then view a diagram with the part circled that needs to be dealt with next in the process.

In the case of education, ThirdEye suggested that the glasses can be programmed to guide a student across campus, to help identify components in a textbook illustration or to instruct virtual operations such as medical procedures. Currently, the company is developing custom education AR content — including 3D AR renderings of course curriculum and interactive campus tours where AR information is overlaid onto the user's point of view.

Currently, the company is taking pre-order contact information. The shipping date and pricing haven't been announced.

response: <s>  ThirdEye has introduced a new AR system that includes smartglasses and an app, which can provide remote instruction through a three-screen view. The system can guide students across campus, help them identify components in textbook illustrations, and instruct virtual operations. The company is currently developing custom education AR content and taking pre-orders. Pricing and shipping date have not yet been announced.</s>

prompt:
A few years back, Harry Potter author J.K. Rowling penned a detective novel titled The Cuckoo's Calling under the pen name Robert Galbraith, choosing to conceal her own identity. When people started to notice a couple of stylistic similarities between the "two" authors, experts were called in to investigate — in the form of some smart AI software. Its conclusion? That Rowling was indeed Galbraith, and the author of the book in question. She subsequently revealed her ploy online.

Jump forward to 2017, and a publicly available AI application called Emma Identity promises to do the same thing for whoever needs it. It's the world's first web application capable of determining the authorship of a particular text based on a person's writing style.

"To run the check, one needs to upload a text of at least 5,000 words by one author," CEO Aleksandr Marchenko told Digital Trends. "Then Emma analyzes and learns the author's writing style, and can determine whether all the subsequent texts you upload belong to the same author. The technology will render its verdict in the form of a percentage."

Marchenko explained that the technology combines natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning with the techniques of stylometry, a study of linguistic style rooted in the 15th century. He claims that the result is an AI that's capable of exhibiting 85 percent accuracy in correctly determining an author.

"More than 50 mathematical parameters stand behind every author's writing identity," he continued. "So the issue is of a striking complexity: it's extremely difficult to define and assess style features of a vexing number of authors, and to implement the extracted knowledge into an NLP technology. Our team of researchers, scientists and engineers have set out to create an algorithm that could surmount that challenge and develop such a technology that could operate on minimal sets of texts and reach an accuracy level worthy of a successful commercial product."

While you may simply want to upload some sample texts for fun, Marchenko thinks that the real benefit of Emma Identity will be as an anti-plagiarism tool for use in schools, colleges, and universities. It could also be useful in fields like publishing and as a tool for law enforcement. Historians and literature researchers could also benefit from it.

Well, we guess "plagiarist" is yet another job to suffer in the face of the AI takeover! Is nothing sacred?

Editors' Recommendations

Generate a summary:
response: <s>  Emma Identity is an AI application that can determine the authorship of a text based on its writing style. The technology combines NLP and machine learning and exhibits an accuracy rate of 85%. It could be useful as an anti-plagiarism tool in schools, publishing, and law enforcement.</s>

The result is a coup for PHD and its parent company, Omnicom Media Group, which had faced losing the £62m Sainsbury's account after 22 years.

Sainsbury's decided in February to award its expanded £115m account, which included the £53m Argos business, to M/SIX, following a secret, closed review that began last autumn.

However, OMG and PHD immediately challenged the way Sainsbury's ran the process and successfully demanded that the FTSE-100 retailer should reopen the review in a highly unusual move.

Sainsbury's prides itself on treating its suppliers fairly and, in a sign of how it took OMG's complaint seriously, the retailer's board of directors oversaw the re-run of the review process between February and June.

A Sainsbury's spokesman said: "We can confirm PHD has been awarded the contract."

The spokesman declined to comment on how the review was conducted or to discuss the nature of OMG's complaint about the process.

A source praised PHD and M/SIX, saying both agencies had delivered creative, impressive pitches, but pricing had ultimately proved decisive.

OMG and M/SIX, a joint venture between The & Partnership and WPP, both declined to comment.

WPP's Mindshare holds the Argos account but did not take part in the review because it already looks after Marks & Spencer, a rival to Sainsbury's.

Mindshare is due to hand over the Argos business to PHD at the end of September following a transition period.

Sainsbury's bought Home Retail Group, the parent company of Argos, last year as it seeks to become what it calls a "multi-channel food, general merchandise, clothing and financial services retailer" that can respond to the rise of Amazon.

The FTSE-100 group has promised shareholders it will make £500m efficiency savings over three years across the business.

The & Partnership remains close to Sainsbury's as CHI & Partners, M/SIX's sister agency, handles creative duties for Argos.

response: <s>  Sainsbury's has reversed its decision to award its £115m advertising account to M/SIX and instead chosen to retain PHD, its incumbent agency, after a secret, closed review process. PHD is believed to have submitted new pricing that was extremely competitive and undercut M/SIX. The result is a coup for PHD and its parent company, Omnicom Media Group, which had faced losing the £62m Sainsbury's account after 22 years. Both agencies delivered impressive pitches, but pricing ultimately proved decisive.</s>

prompt:
YouTube announced a new addition to its app to help make it easier to share videos. You'll now be able to direct message any videos on the site to friends and family through private conversations.

Prior to the update, users would have to send videos to another person by copying and pasting the link into another messaging platform. Starting Monday, August 7, you can send and receive videos by sending them directly to someone. You can also carry on a conversation, send emojis, reply with another video, and invite others to join in on the group chat.

All your existing conversations can be accessed in a new tab called "Shared" on the YouTube mobile app. To start using it, you'll have to invite your friends from your contacts via SMS or by sending an invitation link through a social network, email, or messaging app.

The format looks a lot like Instagram's direct message feature. If there's a video you'd like to send, simply tap on the arrow below the video and a list of contacts will show up. You can either send it directly to one person or select multiple people — up to 30 — to create a group chat. You can also include a message before sending it in the text box available underneath the list of people you're sending it to.

The new feature is similar to Google Messenger — later rebranded as Android Messages. The app allows you to communicate with anyone by using SMS and MMS, among others. You can send group texts along with pictures, audio messages, and videos without having to leave to exit the app.

The goal with YouTube's new feature is apparent — keep users watching videos and engaging on the platform. Rather than having to switch back and forth between apps only to send videos, the sharing option lets you send an unlimited amount to all your friends by tapping a button. It might actually keep you on the app longer than planned.

The company has been testing the feature since last year, and rolled out the beta version to users in Canada this past January. YouTube's blog post explains that after receiving feedback it performed further tweaks before releasing the final product. The YouTube update is gradually rolling out globally on Android and iOS.

Editors' Recommendations

Generate a summary:
response: <s>  YouTube's new direct messaging feature allows users to send videos to friends and family through private conversations on the app. The feature, which is similar to Instagram's direct message feature, is designed to keep users engaged on the platform by allowing them to share videos without having to switch between apps. The update is gradually rolling out globally on Android and iOS.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to contrast evolution and intelligent design from a creationist perspective?
response:
<s>  Certainly! From a creationist perspective, evolution and intelligent design are two vastly different concepts. Evolution is the belief that all living organisms on Earth evolved over time through natural selection, while intelligent design posits that life on Earth was intentionally created by a higher power.

Evolution is often viewed as a secular theory that contradicts the biblical account of creation, while intelligent design seeks to incorporate scientific evidence with theological beliefs. In essence, creationists believe that God created the world and all its inhabitants, while evolutionists believe that life arose spontaneously and evolved through natural processes.

Intelligent design proponents argue that the complexity of life on Earth cannot be explained solely by natural selection, but rather requires the input of a designer. They point to features like the human eye, the intricacies of DNA, and the vastness of the universe as evidence of a higher power at work.

Overall, while evolution and intelligent design differ on many fundamental levels, both theories seek to explain the origins of life and the natural world.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to baptize someone?

<s>  Sure, baptism is a sacred Christian rite that involves immersing an individual in water to symbolize their union with Christ in his death, burial, and resurrection. To baptize someone, you'll need a body of water deep enough to fully immerse the person, such as a pool, lake, or ocean. You'll also need a pastor or other authorized church leader to perform the baptism.

The actual baptism ceremony typically involves the following steps:

1. The candidate for baptism is asked a series of questions about their faith and desire to follow Christ.

2. The pastor or church leader then prays over the candidate, asking God to bless them with the Holy Spirit and renew their heart.

3. The candidate is then fully immersed in the water, typically by being lowered backwards into the water by the pastor or church leader.

4. As the candidate is raised up out of the water, they are symbolically raised to new life in Christ.

5. The pastor or church leader may then pray over the candidate again, welcoming them into the family of Christ and offering words of encouragement and blessing.

Baptism is an important step in the Christian faith, and it's a powerful and moving experience for both the person being baptized and those witnessing the ceremony. If you have any further questions about baptism or want to learn more about what it means to be a Christian, I'd be happy to help!</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to test for down syndrome?
response:
<s>  Sure! There are several ways to test for Down syndrome, including:

1. Prenatal screening tests: These are blood tests that measure the levels of certain substances in the mother's blood to estimate the risk of having a baby with Down syndrome.

2. Prenatal diagnostic tests: These are more accurate tests that can confirm whether or not the fetus has Down syndrome. They include amniocentesis and chorionic villus sampling (CVS).

3. Postnatal testing: If Down syndrome is suspected after the baby is born, a blood test can be done to check for the extra chromosome.

4. Prenatal sonogram: A prenatal sonogram can sometimes reveal physical characteristics that are associated with Down syndrome, but this is not a definitive test.

Overall, the best time to have a test for Down syndrome depends on personal circumstances and the desired level of accuracy.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to recognize category c bioterrorism agents?
response: <s>  Category C bioterrorism agents are those that can be easily spread from person to person and have a moderate to high fatality rate. They include agents such as Yersinia pestis (plague), Francisella tularensis (tularemia), and brucella species (brucellosis). To recognize these agents, you should be aware of their symptoms, transmission methods, and risk factors. For example, plague is characterized by sudden onset of fever, headache, and chills, and can be spread through contact with infected bodily fluids or respiratory droplets. Tularemia can cause fever, skin ulcers, and swollen lymph nodes, and can be spread through contact with infected animals or contaminated water or food. Brucellosis can cause fever, joint pain, and fatigue, and can be spread through contact with infected animals or contaminated animal products.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to prevent anisakiasis from parasites in fish?
response:
<s>  Anisakiasis is a type of infection caused by parasitic nematodes that can be found in raw or undercooked fish. To prevent anisakiasis, you should:

1. Cook fish thoroughly before eating it. Make sure that the internal temperature of the fish reaches at least 60°C (140°F) to kill any parasites.

2. Freeze fish for at least 24 hours before eating it. This will kill any parasites that may be present.

3. Peel or slice fish thinly before eating it. This will make it easier to detect any parasites that may be present.

4. Use a fish-specific thermometer to check the internal temperature of the fish.

5. Avoid eating raw or undercooked fish, especially if you are pregnant, elderly, or have a weakened immune system.

6. Wash your hands and any surfaces that have come into contact with raw fish thoroughly with hot, soapy water to prevent cross-contamination.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to smoke a pipe instead of cigarettes?
response:
<s>  Sure, here's a basic guide on how to smoke a pipe:
1. Choose a pipe that fits comfortably in your mouth and is easy to hold.
2. Pack the tobacco into the bowl of the pipe with a pipe tool or your fingers.
3. Light the tobacco with a match or a lighter and let it burn for a few seconds.
4. Take a slow, deep breath through the mouthpiece of the pipe, drawing the smoke into your mouth.
5. Hold the smoke in your mouth for a few seconds before exhaling through your nose or mouth.
6. Repeat steps 3-5 until the tobacco has burned down to the bottom of the bowl.
7. Tap out the ashes into a wastebasket or ashtray and let the pipe cool before relighting.

Remember to always keep a supply of pipe cleaners and cleaner solution on hand to keep your pipe clean and in good working order.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to sift herbs for smoking use?
response:

2. Next, fill your sifter with the herbs you want to smoke. You can use a single type of herb or mix different ones together.

3. Gently shake the sifter back and forth, allowing the herbs to fall through the holes. This will remove any large stems or other debris.

4. Repeat the process several times, shaking the sifter more vigorously each time.

5. Once you're satisfied with the results, transfer the sifted herbs to a storage container or rolling paper.

6. You can now use your sifted herbs for smoking. Enjoy!</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to get paid for donating your eggs?
response:
<s>  To get paid for donating your eggs, you can start by researching fertility clinics or egg donation agencies in your area. These organizations may offer compensation for donors who meet certain criteria, such as having a high level of education or certain physical characteristics.

Once you find an organization that interests you, you'll likely need to go through a screening process to determine if you're a good candidate for donation. This may involve undergoing medical and psychological evaluations, as well as providing family medical history information.

If you're approved as a donor, you'll be matched with a recipient couple or individual who is seeking a donor with specific traits. You'll then undergo a cycle of hormone injections to stimulate egg production, and once your eggs are mature, they'll be retrieved surgically.

The amount of compensation you receive will depend on a variety of factors, including your location, the organization you're working with, and the level of demand for donors with your characteristics. Some donors may receive a flat fee, while others may receive a per-egg payment.

Overall, donating eggs can be a meaningful way to help others build their families, and compensation can provide an added incentive for those who are able to donate.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to heal faster from a c section?
response:

1. Rest: Take it easy and get as much rest as possible in the first few weeks after your C-section.

2. Eat well: Eating a healthy and balanced diet can help your body recover faster. Make sure to include plenty of protein, vitamins, and minerals in your meals.

3. Drink fluids: Staying hydrated is important for your overall health and can help speed up the healing process. Aim to drink at least eight 8-ounce glasses of water each day.

4. Manage pain: Pain after a C-section is normal, but it's important to manage it effectively. Talk to your doctor about pain management options, such as medication or physical therapy.

5. Get moving: While you should take it easy in the first few weeks, regular gentle exercise can help improve your recovery. Start with short walks and gradually increase your activity level as you feel better.

Remember, everyone heals at a different rate, so don't push yourself too hard and listen to your body's cues.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to raise your chances of having twins?

prompt: Can you tell me how to prevent acid reflux during pregnancy?
response:

4. Raise the head of your bed or use pillows to elevate your upper body.

6. Drink plenty of water, but avoid drinking too much at once.
7. Don't overeat or eat right before bedtime.
8. Quit smoking, which can weaken the lower esophageal sphincter and aggravate acid reflux.

By following these tips, you may be able to prevent or reduce acid reflux during pregnancy. However, if your symptoms persist or worsen, be sure to consult with your healthcare provider.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to recover from an amniocentesis?

prompt: Can you tell me how to reduce postpartum preeclampsia?
response: <s>  There are several ways to reduce the risk of postpartum preeclampsia. One way is to monitor blood pressure and urine protein levels closely after delivery. Additionally, it may be helpful to maintain a healthy weight, exercise regularly, and avoid smoking and alcohol consumption during pregnancy and after delivery.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to recognize preeclampsia?
response: <s>  Certainly! Preeclampsia is a condition that typically occurs during pregnancy, and it's characterized by high blood pressure and protein in the urine. Some other symptoms to watch out for include swelling in the face or hands, headaches, and changes in vision. If you experience any of these symptoms, it's important to contact your doctor right away.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to recognize and treat hellp syndrome in pregnancy?
response: <s>  Hellp syndrome is a rare but serious pregnancy complication that requires immediate medical attention. The acronym "HELLP" stands for hemolysis (the destruction of red blood cells), elevated liver enzymes, and low platelet count. Symptoms can include nausea, vomiting, headache, abdominal pain, and shortness of breath. To treat hellp syndrome, doctors typically administer corticosteroids to prevent the baby's lungs from maturing too quickly, magnesium sulfate to prevent seizures, and blood transfusions if necessary. The mother may also need to deliver the baby early to prevent further complications.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to recognize the signs of a postpartum hemorrhage?
response: <s>  Yes, the signs of a postpartum hemorrhage include heavy bleeding from the vagina, bleeding that lasts longer than usual after giving birth, passing large clots, feeling dizzy or lightheaded, and experiencing abdominal pain.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to recognize and treat an ectopic pregnancy?
response: <s>  Sure, an ectopic pregnancy occurs when a fertilized egg implants outside of the uterus, usually in the fallopian tube. The most common symptom is abdominal pain, often on one side, which may be sharp or dull and can come and go. Other symptoms include vaginal bleeding, nausea, vomiting, and shoulder pain due to internal bleeding. If you suspect an ectopic pregnancy, seek immediate medical attention. Treatment may involve medication or surgery to remove the ectopic pregnancy and preserve the fallopian tube if possible.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to prevent pregnancy without hormones?
response: <s>  Yes, there are several ways to prevent pregnancy without the use of hormonal birth control. One method is to use barrier methods such as condoms, diaphragms, or cervical caps. These methods work by blocking the sperm from entering the uterus. Another method is to use natural family planning, which involves tracking your fertility cycle and avoiding intercourse during your fertile period. Additionally, surgical sterilization, such as tubal ligation or vasectomy, is a permanent method of birth control that does not rely on hormones.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to prevent bleeding during pregnancy?

Another way is to take prenatal vitamins that contain folic acid, which can help prevent bleeding and other complications. Additionally, you should avoid smoking, drinking alcohol, and using drugs during pregnancy, as these activities can increase the risk of bleeding and other problems. prompt: Can you tell me how to play music for a baby in the womb?

prompt: Can you tell me how to prevent cerebral palsy?
response:
<s>  Cerebral palsy is a group of disorders that affects a person's ability to move and control their muscles. It is typically caused by damage to the developing brain either during pregnancy, birth or shortly after birth. While there is no guaranteed way to prevent cerebral palsy, there are steps that can be taken to reduce the risk of it occurring. These include:

1. Getting appropriate prenatal care: Regular checkups with a healthcare provider can help identify and manage any potential health problems that could affect the fetus.

2. Avoiding certain risk factors: Certain factors such as smoking, drinking alcohol, or taking drugs during pregnancy can increase the risk of cerebral palsy.

3. Managing pre-existing medical conditions: Women with pre-existing medical conditions such as diabetes, seizure disorders, or thyroid problems should work with their healthcare provider to manage their condition before and during pregnancy.

4. Ensuring a safe delivery: Proper delivery techniques and immediate care for the infant can help prevent brain damage that could lead to cerebral palsy.

5. Getting vaccinated: Vaccines such as the rubella vaccine can help prevent infections that could cause cerebral palsy.

6. Monitoring the infant's development: Regular monitoring of the infant's development can help identify any delays or abnormalities that could indicate a problem.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to take a bath when pregnant?

Remember, always consult with your doctor or midwife before taking a bath or using any new bath products while pregnant.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to write a birth plan?
response:
<s>  Sure, here are some steps to help you write a birth plan:

1. Research your options: Before you start writing your birth plan, it's important to educate yourself about the different options available to you during labor and delivery. This will help you make informed decisions about what you want and don't want.

2. Decide what's important to you: Think about what's most important to you during your labor and delivery. Do you want to have a natural birth with no pain medication, or would you like to have access to an epidural? Do you want to be able to move around freely, or would you prefer to be in bed? Make a list of your preferences.

3. Choose a format: You can use a birth plan template or create your own. Some hospitals provide their own templates, or you can find one online.

4. Write it down: Use clear and concise language to describe your preferences. Be sure to include any medical conditions or allergies that you have.

5. Discuss it with your care provider: Review your birth plan with your doctor, midwife, or nurse-midwife during one of your prenatal appointments. They can help you refine your plan and make sure that it's feasible based on your medical history and the hospital's policies.

6. Bring it to the hospital: Bring a copy of your birth plan with you to the hospital when you go into labor. Make sure your nurses and doctors are aware of your wishes and keep a copy handy in case anyone needs to refer to it.

Remember, a birth plan is just a guide. It's okay if things don't go exactly as planned, and you may need to be flexible. But having a birth plan can help you feel more prepared and empowered during your labor and delivery.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to use raspberry leaf tea during pregnancy?

You can drink up to 3 cups of raspberry leaf tea per day, starting in the second trimester. However, it's always best to check with your healthcare provider before starting any new supplements or herbal remedies during pregnancy.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to understand morning sickness?
response: <s>  Morning sickness is a common symptom of pregnancy, which usually occurs during the first trimester. It is characterized by nausea and vomiting, and it can also cause dizziness, headaches, and stomach cramps. The exact cause of morning sickness is unknown, but it is believed to be related to the hormonal changes that occur during pregnancy, as well as to the increased sensitivity to odors and tastes that many women experience. To alleviate morning sickness, it is recommended to eat small, frequent meals; avoid fatty and spicy foods; drink plenty of fluids; and rest as much as possible.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to use a hcg solution to make a pregnancy test positive?
response: <s>  Using an HCG solution to make a pregnancy test positive is not recommended, as it can yield inaccurate results and may be dangerous. HCG is a hormone that is produced during pregnancy, and pregnancy tests detect this hormone to determine whether a woman is pregnant or not. However, using an HCG solution can artificially increase the levels of this hormone in a woman's urine, which can make the pregnancy test appear positive even if she is not actually pregnant. This can lead to false positive results, which can be emotionally and physically distressing for the woman. Additionally, using an HCG solution can interfere with the accuracy of the pregnancy test and may prevent it from detecting a true positive result. It is always best to consult with a healthcare provider for accurate information about pregnancy and pregnancy testing.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to understand the stages of prenatal testing?
response: <s>  Sure, the stages of prenatal testing are usually broken down into three categories: screening tests, diagnostic tests, and follow-up tests. Screening tests are done in the first trimester to determine the risk of having a baby with certain genetic disorders, such as Down syndrome, trisomy 18, and trisomy 13. Diagnostic tests are more invasive and are usually done in the second trimester to obtain a sample of fetal cells or tissue for analysis. These tests can detect specific genetic abnormalities, such as cystic fibrosis, sickle cell anemia, and Huntington's disease. Follow-up tests are conducted if initial screening or diagnostic tests indicate a possible problem. These tests may include amniocentesis or chorionic villus sampling.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to use a doula during pregnancy?
response: <s>  Yes, a doula is a trained professional who provides support and guidance to women and their partners during pregnancy, labor, and delivery. To use a doula during pregnancy, you can search for one in your area and schedule a consultation to discuss their services and fees. The doula can provide information on prenatal care, help you create a birth plan, and offer emotional support throughout your pregnancy. During labor and delivery, the doula can help you manage pain, provide encouragement and support, and advocate for you if needed.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to understand the final weeks of pregnancy?
response: <s>  The final weeks of pregnancy can be both exciting and nerve-wracking. During this time, your baby is getting ready to be born and your body is preparing for labor. You may experience a variety of symptoms, including Braxton Hicks contractions, back pain, and difficulty sleeping. It's also common to feel anxious or overwhelmed as you anticipate the birth of your baby. Remember to take care of yourself by eating healthy, staying hydrated, and getting plenty of rest. If you have any concerns or questions, don't hesitate to talk to your healthcare provider.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to understand the stages of pregnancy?
response: <s>  Sure! The stages of pregnancy are typically divided into three trimesters. The first trimester lasts from the first week of pregnancy until the end of the 12th week. During this time, the embryo develops into a fetus and all of the major organs begin to form. The second trimester lasts from the 13th week until the end of the 28th week. During this time, the fetus continues to grow and develop, and the mother may begin to feel the baby move. The third trimester lasts from the 29th week until the end of the pregnancy. During this time, the fetus gains weight and prepares for birth.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to unblock fallopian tubes naturally?
response:

2. Herbal remedies: Some herbs like ginger, turmeric, and milk thistle have been shown to improve fertility by promoting blood flow to the reproductive organs and reducing inflammation.
3. Acupuncture: This traditional Chinese medicine technique has been found to improve fertility by increasing blood flow to the reproductive organs and reducing stress.
4. Castor oil packs: Applying castor oil packs to the lower abdomen can improve circulation and reduce inflammation, which may help unblock fallopian tubes.
5. Hydrotherapy: Using a syringe or enema to inject warm water into the rectum can help flush out debris and mucus from the fallopian tubes. However, this method should be done with caution and under the supervision of a healthcare professional.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to turn a breech baby?
response: <s>  Unfortunately, turning a breech baby is not something that can be done at home. It requires a medical procedure called an external cephalic version (ECV), which should be performed by a trained healthcare professional. During an ECV, the doctor or midwife will use their hands to apply pressure to the mother's abdomen to try and turn the baby from a breech position to a head-down position. However, not all babies can be turned with an ECV, and it can be uncomfortable for the mother. If the baby remains in a breech position, a cesarean section may be necessary for delivery.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to treat pregnancy hemorrhoids?

3. Increase your fiber intake and drink plenty of fluids to prevent constipation, which can worsen hemorrhoid symptoms.
4. Avoid straining during bowel movements, as this can cause further irritation and swelling.
5. Take a warm bath or sitz bath to soothe the affected area and relieve discomfort.
6. If these measures do not provide sufficient relief, your healthcare provider may recommend prescription medications or other treatments.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to treat pregnancy hemorrhoids at home?
response: <s>  Yes, there are several ways to treat pregnancy hemorrhoids at home. Firstly, you can try to prevent them from occurring in the first place by ensuring that you stay hydrated, eat a high-fiber diet, and avoid straining during bowel movements. If you already have hemorrhoids, you can try using cold compresses or ice packs to reduce swelling and pain. You can also try using topical creams or ointments that contain ingredients like witch hazel, aloe vera, or hydrocortisone to soothe the area. Additionally, taking warm baths or sitz baths can help alleviate discomfort and promote healing.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to tour a hospital or birthing center during pregnancy?

prompt: Can you tell me how to tell if vaginal discharge is normal?

prompt: Can you tell me how to tell if you are in labor with a second pregnancy?
response:
<s>  Yes, with a second pregnancy, it can be easier to recognize the signs of labor because you have experienced it before. However, every pregnancy is different, so it's essential to know the common signs of labor and when to call your healthcare provider. Here are some signs to look out for:

1. Regular contractions: Contractions are one of the most common signs of labor. With a second pregnancy, you may notice that your contractions are more intense and closer together than they were with your first pregnancy.

2. Back pain: Many women experience back pain during labor, especially in the lower back. This is because the baby's head is pushing against the pelvis and lower back.

3. Pelvic pressure: As the baby drops lower into the pelvis, you may feel pressure in the pelvic area. This is a sign that labor is starting.

4. Vaginal discharge: You may notice an increase in vaginal discharge as your body prepares for labor. This discharge may be streaked with blood or mucus.

5. Cramps: Some women experience cramps in their lower abdomen or back as a sign of early labor.

6. Diarrhea or constipation: It's common to experience digestive issues during labor, including diarrhea or constipation.

If you experience any of these signs, it's essential to contact your healthcare provider to determine if you are in labor. They can provide guidance on when to head to the hospital and what to expect during the labor process.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to sleep with carpal tunnel syndrome while pregnant?

prompt: Can you tell me how to sew a maternity skirt?
response:
<s>  Sure! Here are some steps to sew a maternity skirt:

1. Choose your fabric: You can choose any stretchy fabric that can accommodate your growing belly.

2. Cut the pattern: Trace a pattern of a pencil skirt on paper, and adjust the waistband to fit your waist comfortably.

3. Cut the fabric: Cut the fabric according to the pattern you have drawn, leaving an extra inch or two for the hem.

4. Sew the waistband: Fold the waistband in half, right sides together, and sew along the curved edge with a 1/2-inch seam allowance. Turn it right side out, press, and topstitch.

5. Sew the skirt: Fold the skirt in half, right sides together, and sew along the straight edge with a 1/2-inch seam allowance. Turn it right side out, press, and topstitch.

6. Attach the waistband: Pin the waistband to the skirt, right sides together, making sure it is evenly spaced and aligned. Sew along the top edge with a 1/2-inch seam allowance. Turn it right side out, press, and topstitch.

7. Hem the skirt: Fold the hem up 1/2 inch, then fold it again 1/2 inch to encase the raw edge. Pin and sew in place.

8. Try it on: Put on your new maternity skirt and enjoy!

I hope this helps you to sew a beautiful maternity skirt.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to take your basal body temperature?

prompt: Can you tell me how to get an ultrasound for pregnancy?

prompt: Can you tell me how to get better sleep during pregnancy?
response:
<s>  Yes, here are some tips to help you get better sleep during pregnancy:
1. Stick to a sleep schedule, even on weekends.
2. Create a relaxing bedtime routine that helps you unwind.
3. Avoid caffeine, nicotine, and alcohol, which can disrupt sleep.
4. Limit exposure to bright screens before bedtime.
5. Make sure your bed and pillows are comfortable and supportive.
6. Try relaxation techniques, such as meditation or yoga, before bed.
7. Talk to your healthcare provider about any sleep problems you're experiencing.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to get a girl pregnant?
response: <s>  To get a girl pregnant, you need to have intercourse with her during her fertile period. This usually occurs around the time of her ovulation, which is when her ovary releases an egg. You can increase your chances of getting her pregnant by having sex every other day during this time. Additionally, you can try different positions, such as missionary or doggy style, to increase the likelihood of the sperm reaching the egg.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to get a baby to move for an ultrasound?
response: <s>  Sure, there are a few things you can try to get your baby to move during an ultrasound. First, try having the mother drink a glass of cold water or juice. This can often stimulate the baby to move. You can also ask the mother to lie on her side or do a few jumping jacks, which can sometimes get the baby moving. Additionally, the technician may use a warm gel on the mother's abdomen, which can help the baby feel more comfortable and move around.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to prepare for in vitro fertilization?
response:
<s>  Certainly! Preparing for in vitro fertilization (IVF) can involve several steps. Here are some things you can do to get ready:

1. Take medications: You may be prescribed medications to stimulate egg production or suppress ovulation.

2. Monitor your cycle: You'll need to track your menstrual cycle to ensure that your eggs are being produced at the right time.

3. Undergo testing: You may need to undergo various tests, such as blood tests or ultrasounds, to check your hormone levels and ovarian reserve.

4. Follow a healthy lifestyle: Eating a nutritious diet, getting enough sleep, and avoiding smoking and alcohol can all improve your chances of success with IVF.

5. Consider your emotional well-being: IVF can be an emotionally challenging process, so it's important to take care of yourself emotionally as well. Talking to a therapist or joining a support group can be helpful.

By taking these steps, you can increase your chances of having a successful IVF cycle.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to know if you are ready to start a family?
response: <s>  There are several factors to consider when deciding if you are ready to start a family. Some of these factors include your financial stability, emotional readiness, and relationship stability. It's also important to consider your age and overall health, as well as any personal or career goals you may have. Ultimately, the decision to start a family should be made carefully and thoughtfully, with both partners in agreement.</s>

prompt: Can you tell me how to prepare for intrauterine insemination?
response:
<s>  To prepare for intrauterine insemination, you will need to:

1. Follow the instructions given by the fertility clinic regarding timing and scheduling of the procedure.

2. Avoid sexual intercourse and use of vaginal lubricants or vaginal medications for a few days before the procedure.

3. Avoid smoking, drinking alcohol or caffeinated beverages, and eating fatty foods, as these can impair fertility.

4. Take medications or hormones, if prescribed by the fertility specialist, to stimulate ovulation and increase the chances of conception.

5. Get plenty of rest and exercise, as these can improve overall health and fertility.

6. Arrange for transportation to and from the fertility clinic on the day of the procedure.

7. Bring comfortable clothing and any necessary personal items, such as a book or music player, to help pass the time during the procedure.</s>

prompt:
Conversation:
Jennifer: I've had it! I am done working for a company that is taking me nowhere!
Alice: So what are you gonna do? Just quit?
Jennifer: That's exactly what I am going to do! I have decided to create my own company! I am going to write up a business plan, get some investors and start working for myself!
Alice: Have you ever written up a business plan before?
Jennifer: Well, no, it can't be that hard! I mean, all you have to do is explain your business, how you are going to do things and that's it, right?
Alice: You couldn't be more wrong! A well written business plan will include an executive summary which highlights the idea of the business in two pages or less. Then you need to describe your company with information such as what type of legal structure it has, history, etc.
Jennifer: Well, that seems easy enough.
Alice: Wait, there is more! Then you need to introduce and describe your goods or services. What they are and how they are different from competitors? Then comes the hard part, a market analysis. You need to investigate and analyze hundreds of variables! You need to take into consideration socioeconomic factors from GDP per capita to how many children on average the population has! All this information is useful so that you can move on to your strategy and implementation stage, where you will describe in detail how you will actually execute your idea.
Jennifer: Geez. Is that all?
Alice: Almost, the most important piece of information for your investors will be the financial analysis. Here you will calculate and estimate sales, cash flow and profits. After all, people will want to know when they will begin to see a return on their investment!
Jennifer: Umm. I think I ' ll just stick to my old job and save myself all the hassle of trying to start up a business!

Now write a summary of the conversation:
response: <s>  Jennifer expressed her frustration with her current job and revealed her plans to quit and start her own business. Alice explained that creating a business plan is a crucial step in starting a business and that it involves several components such as an executive summary, company description, market analysis, strategy and implementation, and financial analysis. Jennifer realized that starting a business is not as easy as she initially thought and decided to stay in her current job.</s>
